t: Luke 8
And*p it came to pass afterward, that he went throughout every city and village, preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God: and the twelve were with him,
And*p certain women, which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,
And*p Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto him of their substance.
And*p when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:

A*rp sower*r went*r out*r to*r sow*r his*r seed:*r and*r as*r he*r sowed,*r some*r fell*r by*r the*r way*r side;*r and*r it*r was*r trodden*r down,*r and*r the*r fowls*r of*r the*r air*r devoured*r it.*r
And*rp some*r fell*r upon*r a*r rock;*r and*r as*r soon*r as*r it*r was*r sprung*r up,*r it*r withered*r away,*r because*r it*r lacked*r moisture.*r
And*rp some*r fell*r among*r thorns;*r and*r the*r thorns*r sprang*r up*r with*r it,*r and*r choked*r it.*r

And*rp other*r fell*r on*r good*r ground,*r and*r sprang*r up,*r and*r bare*r fruit*r an*r hundredfold.*r And when he had said these things, he cried, He*r that*r hath*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r
And*p his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?

And*p he said, Unto*r you*r it*r is*r given*r to*r know*r the*r mysteries*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God:*r but*r to*r others*r in*r parables;*r that*r seeing*r they*r might*r not*r see,*r and*r hearing*r they*r might*r not*r understand.*r
Now*rp the*r parable*r is*r this:*r The*r seed*r is*r the*r word*r of*r God.*r

Those*rp by*r the*r way*r side*r are*r they*r that*r hear;*r then*r cometh*r the*r devil,*r and*r taketh*r away*r the*r word*r out*r of*r their*r hearts,*r lest*r they*r should*r believe*r and*r be*r saved.*r

They*rp on*r the*r rock*r are*r they,*r which,*r when*r they*r hear,*r receive*r the*r word*r with*r joy;*r and*r these*r have*r no*r root,*r which*r for*r a*r while*r believe,*r and*r in*r time*r of*r temptation*r fall*r away.*r

And*rp that*r which*r fell*r among*r thorns*r are*r they,*r which,*r when*r they*r have*r heard,*r go*r forth,*r and*r are*r choked*r with*r cares*r and*r riches*r and*r pleasures*r of*r this*r life,*r and*r bring*r no*r fruit*r to*r perfection.*r
But*rp that*r on*r the*r good*r ground*r are*r they,*r which*r in*r an*r honest*r and*r good*r heart,*r having*r heard*r the*r word,*r keep*r it,*r and*r bring*r forth*r fruit*r with*r patience.*r

No*rp man,*r when*r he*r hath*r lighted*r a*r candle,*r covereth*r it*r with*r a*r vessel,*r or*r putteth*r it*r under*r a*r bed;*r but*r setteth*r it*r on*r a*r candlestick,*r that*r they*r which*r enter*r in*r may*r see*r the*r light.*r
For*rp nothing*r is*r secret,*r that*r shall*r not*r be*r made*r manifest;*r neither*r any*r thing*r hid,*r that*r shall*r not*r be*r known*r and*r come*r abroad.*r

Take*rp heed*r therefore*r how*r ye*r hear:*r for*r whosoever*r hath,*r to*r him*r shall*r be*r given;*r and*r whosoever*r hath*r not,*r from*r him*r shall*r be*r taken*r even*r that*r which*r he*r seemeth*r to*r have.*r
Then*p came to him his mother and his brethren, and could not come at him for the press.
And*p it was told him by certain which said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.
And*p he answered and said unto them, My*r mother*r and*r my*r brethren*r are*r these*r which*r hear*r the*r word*r of*r God,*r and*r do*r it.*r

Now*p it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them, Let*r us*r go*r over*r unto*r the*r other*r side*r of*r the*r lake.*r And they launched forth.
But*p as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled with water, and were in jeopardy.
And*p they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. Then he arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.
And*p he said unto them, Where*r is*r your*r faith?*r And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this! for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.
And*p they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.
And*p when he went forth to land, there met him out of the city a certain man, which had devils long time, and ware no clothes, neither abode in any house, but in the tombs.
When*p he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God most high? I beseech thee, torment me not.

(For*p he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For oftentimes it had caught him: and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and was driven of the devil into the wilderness.)
And*p Jesus asked him, saying, What*r is*r thy*r name?*r And he said, Legion: because many devils were entered into him.
And*p they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep.
And*p there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.
Then*p went the devils out of the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake, and were choked.
When*p they that fed them saw what was done, they fled, and went and told it in the city and in the country.

Then*p they went out to see what was done; and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
They*p also which saw it told them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed.
Then*p the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great fear: and he went up into the ship, and returned back again.
Now*p the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him: but Jesus sent him away, saying,

Return*rp to*r thine*r own*r house,*r and*r shew*r how*r great*r things*r God*r hath*r done*r unto*r thee.*r And he went his way, and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him.
And*p it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the people gladly received him: for they were all waiting for him.
And,*p behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus' feet, and besought him that he would come into his house:
For*p he had one only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying. But as he went the people thronged him.
And*p a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, which had spent all her living upon physicians, neither could be healed of any,
Came*p behind him, and touched the border of his garment: and immediately her issue of blood stanched.
And*p Jesus said, Who*r touched*r me?*r When all denied, Peter and they that were with him said, Master, the multitude throng thee and press thee, and sayest thou, Who*r touched*r me?*r
And*p Jesus said, Somebody*r hath*r touched*r me:*r for*r I*r perceive*r that*r virtue*r is*r gone*r out*r of*r me.*r

And*p when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him, she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
And*p he said unto her, Daughter,*r be*r of*r good*r comfort:*r thy*r faith*r hath*r made*r thee*r whole;*r go*r in*r peace.*r
While*p he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue's house, saying to him, Thy daughter is dead; trouble not the Master.
But*p when Jesus heard it, he answered him, saying, Fear*r not:*r believe*r only,*r and*r she*r shall*r be*r made*r whole.*r
And*p when he came into the house, he suffered no man to go in, save Peter, and James, and John, and the father and the mother of the maiden.
And*p all wept, and bewailed her: but he said, Weep*r not;*r she*r is*r not*r dead,*r but*r sleepeth.*r
And*p they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.
And*p he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying, Maid,*r arise.*r
And*p her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.
And*p her parents were astonished: but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done.
